_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary

Facility:    West Central AGRIServices, LLC. - Chilhowee
Location:    209 East Barnum, Chilhowee, Mo.
Contact:     Mike Simon
Phone:     660-678-2411


1. The Facility Policy

West Central AGRIServices, LLC., and the employees of the West Central AGRIServices, LLC., of Chilhowee are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Johnson County Fire Protection District, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information

The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of bulk dry fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient. The facility also handles feed, grain, agricultural chemicals and farm supply.

The facility has (1) 26,000-gallon storage tank and (1) 18,000-gallon storage tank. The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a transport delivery truck holding approximately 50,000 pounds. The facility also has (33) 1,000-gallon nurse tanks for product distribution.

3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1981", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".

4. The Five-year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.
